pullRequest.body:
Proof that `Algebra.trace R R a = a`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [834af884fe](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20865/commits/834af884fe258b8901e34824232d1323d28d69a9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ trace_self`
`+ trace_self_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: mistarro can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
@riccardobrasca is it now what you meant? BTW, I was wondering why `ext` leaves me with a proof that `f 1 = g 1` and not general `f x = g x`...

> @riccardobrasca is it now what you meant? BTW, I was wondering why `ext` leaves me with a proof that `f 1 = g 1` and not general `f x = g x`...

Yes, this is what I meant.

`ext` is a tactic that calls any lemma tagged with `ext`. Here it is smart enough to use `LinearMap.ext_ring`.
bors r+

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12869839601/job/35879553989)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12871073063/job/35883559357)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12871073063/job/35883558997)

I think the linter will complain, since now `simp` can do two different things about `trace R R a`. I suggest to swap the order of the theorems, than the proof of the second one can be `by simp` (and it should not be tagged `simp` itself).

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

I think the linter will complain, since now `simp` can do two different things about `trace R R a`. I suggest to swap the order of the theorems, than the proof of the second one can be `by simp` (and it should not be tagged `simp` itself).
The current standard is that we don't squeeze terminal `simp`, otherwise LGTM.
What do you mean by "we don't squeeze terminal `simp`"?
Remove `only` and also any lemmas in the list which you can remove when you've done this (e.g. `one_smul`). We usually only use `only` when `simp` is not the last line of the proof.

```suggestion
@[simp] theorem trace_self (a : R) : trace R R a = a := by
```
Could you please prove the lemma about `trace R R` as well, without applying it to an element `a`?

```suggestion
theorem trace_self_apply (a) : trace R R a = a := by
```
This theorem can be proved by simp, after the next lemma.
But `trace_self` is now proved from this one; or do you mean to remove `@[simp]` as suggested and mention it directly?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Trace): the trace from a ring `R` to itself is the identity
